item.title: Twelve-year-old boy makes Â£290,000 from whale NFTs
item.description: Benyamin Ahmed created a set of more than 3,000 whale images and sold digital tokens of them.

item.title: Overwatch to change cowboy character McCree's name
item.description: Cowboy character Jesse McCree will be renamed after his namesake leaves Activision-Blizzard.

item.title: Apple tweaks app pay rules in $100m settlement
item.description: Developers will be able to tell app customers how to avoid Apple's 30% cut on payments.

item.title: Apple chief executive Tim Cook gets $750m payout
item.description: The award of more than five million Apple shares comes as Mr Cook marks a decade as the firm's boss.

item.title: Peloton cuts price of bike as sales growth slows
item.description: The fitness company's losses have widened as people head back to gyms to exercise.

item.title: Data protection 'shake-up' takes aim at cookie pop-ups
item.description: A new head has been appointed to the UK data regulator amid a plan to drive the economy using data.

item.title: The real victims of mass crypto-hacks that keep happening
item.description: Millions in Bitcoin and other digital coins are being stolen by hackers with victims left in limbo.

item.title: OnlyFans suspends policy change after backlash
item.description: The platform had sparked controversy when it revealed plans to ban sex workers from its platform.

item.title: Zoom announces hybrid return to workplace
item.description: Only 1% of employees at the firm want to return to the office full-time, the video calls firm says.

item.title: Virgin Hyperloop unveils new pod concept video
item.description: The high-speed evacuated-tube transportation company reveals its plans for passenger pods

item.title: Sensors and AI to monitor Dorset social care patients
item.description: Data from sensors in patients' homes will be analysed to warn of health problems.

item.title: Little penguin feeding behaviour revealed with trackers
item.description: Ten males were fitted with sensors in the breeding season to give greater insight into the birds.

item.title: Gadget reviews: Smart cool boxes and neck fans
item.description: Lara Lewington looks at some of the latest gadgets to help make the most of your summer.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds: Video games and the making of Free Guy
item.description: Actor and producer Ryan Reynolds on preparing to play a character caught up in a multiplayer game.

item.title: The NI inventor who saved thousands of lives
item.description: The plane ejector seat was invented by James Martin, from Crossgar in County Down, in 1944.

item.title: Green aviation: Electric powered plane trialled over Orkney
item.description: A hybrid-electric plane is being trialled in Orkney as part of a study into ways of reducing aviation emissions.

item.title: Why is there a chip shortage?
item.description: The big chip crunch is really biting now, leaving even the most unexpected industries in crisis.

item.title: Why phone scams are so difficult to tackle
item.description: Phone fraud, both via calls and text messages, has soared during the pandemic.

item.title: How virtual reality can help to recruit and train staff
item.description: VR headsets are making a leap from fun gimmick to serious tool for firms' workforce management.

item.title: Just how hard is it to recycle a jumbo jet?
item.description: Thousands of aircraft were left on the tarmac due to Covid, and many will now be broken up for parts.

item.title: Would you let a robot lawyer defend you?
item.description: Why artificial intelligence is increasingly being used by the legal profession.

item.title: How can new technology protect outdoor workers?
item.description: Working outdoors in extreme heat can be deadly, new tech and better protection for workers could help.

item.title: Sharing apps are booming but will the kindness continue?
item.description: The pandemic sparked a surge in activity for sharing apps like Olio but has the trend run its course?
